musicalLanguage.description: Henry Mancini's slinky, chromatic theme is one of the most instantly recognizable melodies in cinema. Built on a chromatic creeping figure in E minor, the theme captures the sneaky, cat-like quality of the animated panther. The arrangement uses jazz swing feel with walking chromatic lines and punchy staccato chords. The left hand plays a cool jazz bass pattern.
musicalLanguage.structure: Intro creep (2 bars), Main riff with chromatic climb (4 bars), Tag (2 bars)
keyMoments: Bars 1-2: The famous chromatic creep — E-F-F#-G. The panther appears.
Bars 5-6: The riff hits its stride with the jazzy chord stabs.
Bar 8: The sly ending — chromatic slide back to E. The panther vanishes.
teachingGoals: Jazz swing feel — slightly uneven eighth notes
Staccato articulation for the sneaky character
styleTips: Slinky and sneaky — imagine tiptoeing past a security guard
Swing the eighth notes slightly — not straight, not full shuffle
Every note should be staccato and precise — the panther is smooth

measures.teachingNote: The chromatic creep begins after a half rest. Quiet and slinky.

measures.rightHand: A4:q R:q E4:e F4:e F#4:e G4:e
measures.teachingNote: A4 stab then repeat the creep. The panther keeps sneaking.

measures.rightHand: A4:q R:q C5:e R:e A4:e R:e
measures.teachingNote: Staccato stabs — A4, C5, A4. Punchy jazz accents.

measures.rightHand: B4:q R:q E4:e F4:e F#4:e G4:e
measures.teachingNote: B4 stab then back to the creep. The riff is circular.

measures.rightHand: A4:q R:e B4:e C5:q R:e D5:e
measures.teachingNote: The melody climbs — A, B, C, D. Building sneaky energy.
Peak and descent — E5 is the high point. Everything staccato.
Chromatic descent — the reverse of the opening creep.
E stab then silence. The panther has disappeared. Cool ending.
